alert.note: Alert for Middlesex; Somerset (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 11:19AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Somerset and northeastern Middlesex Counties through 1145 AM EDT... At 1119 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over New Brunswick, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... New Brunswick, Somerset, Edison, East Brunswick, Sayreville, North Brunswick, North Brunswick Township, Society Hill, Woodbridge, South River, Highland Park, Metuchen, Milltown, Fords and Iselin. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 10 and 12. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 4. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 124 and 132. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
